title: Why Wrigley Field has turned into a hitter's worst nightmare -- and what it means for this October and beyond
content: When the wind is blowing in, there are few things worse than stepping to the plate at the Friendly Confines.

title: Browns coach not yet ready to tab Sanders QB2
content: Browns coach Kevin Stefanski on Wednesday was noncommittal on if rookie Shedeur Sanders -- or practice squad quarterback Bailey Zappe -- would be the team's backup quarterback in the aftermath of trading Joe Flacco to the Bengals.

title: Iverson discusses sobriety, lowest point in life
content: Allen Iverson discussed his life, basketball career and new memoir "Misunderstood" with Stephen A. Smith on ESPN's "First Take" on Wednesday.

title: Bengals to start Flacco at QB against Packers
content: The Bengals will start newly acquired quarterback Joe Flacco this Sunday against the Packers, coach Zac Taylor announced Wednesday.

title: Cards watch Murray foot injury as QB day-to-day
content: Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray (foot) will not practice Wednesday and is considered day-to-day for the rest of the week, coach Jonathan Gannon said.

title: Former player donates $50M to Stanford football
content: The Stanford football program received a $50 million gift from a former player, the school announced Wednesday, marking a significant donation as it attempts to revive the fortunes of the program under general manager Andrew Luck.

title: Jets lock up forward Connor with $96M extension
content: The Winnipeg Jets have signed star forward Kyle Connor to an eight-year, $96 million extension, the team announced on Wednesday.

title: Broncos' Powers (biceps) to miss significant time
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said Wednesday that left guard Ben Powers will miss significant time with a biceps injury.

title: Eagles stars downplay meeting amid recent woes
content: Eagles stars Saquon Barkley and Jalen Hurts confirmed that they spoke with A.J. Brown earlier this week but dismissed the idea that the meeting was contentious.

title: 😡 Bottom 10: Not-So-Happy Valley these days
content: Another loss by Penn State put the Nittany Lions -- and the Bottom 10 committee -- in a bit of a predicament.

title: The latest buzz around the NFL: Insiders on Geno Smith, Daniel Jones and extensions on the horizon
content: Are the Raiders worried about Smith? Can Jones keep rolling? Which players could get extended soon? And which coordinators might get head coaching interest?

title: The biting barb that spurred Chelsea Gray and the Aces
content: The Aces' "Point Gawd" has returned to form in the WNBA Finals. She traces her late-season upswing to a comment from A'ja Wilson.

title: 'I have not been back yet': Why Georgia fans haven't forgiven Auburn 39 years later
content: In 1986, Auburn sprayed hoses at Bulldogs fans, including current QB Gunner Stockton's grandfather, and they haven't forgotten it.

title: He could go all the ... what?!? 7 times an NFL player dropped the ball short of the end zone
content: Emari Demercado, Adonai Mitchell and Jonathan Taylor will share the field Sunday and a bond they'd rather forget.

title: Kung Fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A 'traumatic experience' with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

title: On MLB playoffs brink, will Tigers' unwavering faith be enough?
content: Manager A.J. Hinch's resolute confidence helped steady Detroit after tailspin. Can they pull it off again?

title: Wyshynski predicts every NHL team's finish in 2025-26
content: As the season begins, we reveal which teams will make the Stanley Cup Final, the playoffs and the draft lottery.

title: Stephanie 'La Primera' Vaquer's WWE career marked by historic firsts
content: Stephanie Vaquer shares her path to WWE, and how a memorable night in Indianapolis helped her fulfill "the dream of my life."

title: Leicester's Premier League win, 10 years later: How did they do it, and could a team repeat it?
content: Leicester's stunning title win remains one of the great underdog stories in sports. What do the players who made it happen think of their achievement today? And will we ever see a team match their feat?

title: Police: Lacy's driving set off events in fatal crash
content: Louisiana State Police released video and records related to a fatal crash in December 2024 they allege was caused by ex-LSU football player Kyren Lacy.

title: Eli Manning in 'Chad Powers' reminds us to believe
content: Eli Manning, a two-time Super Bowl MVP and NFL legend, on "Chad Powers" and the possibility of second chances.

title: Win projections for all 30 NBA teams: How we see the East, West playing out
content: ESPN NBA analyst Kevin Pelton unveils his annual win projections for all 30 teams. Where does your team land?

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo has finally put the Milwaukee Bucks on the clock
content: In a transformative summer for the Bucks, the team had discussions about moving the two-time MVP to New York.

title: Inside Vikings' Euro trip: Lack of sleep, 'Terrible Towels' and what's next for J.J. McCarthy
content: Minnesota volunteered to be the first team to play back-to-back games in two countries outside the U.S. Was it worth it?

title: 'There was no flinch': Was Sunday a defining moment for Panthers QB Bryce Young?
content: Despite trailing 17-0 and committing two turnovers, Young found the fortitude to rally the Panthers on Sunday.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Patience is a virtue. Until it isn't
content: If your team isn't winning, shake things up. These seven players might offer sneaky start or trade value.

title: Matchup rankings: Matthew Stafford, Jacory Croskey-Merritt stand out in Week 6
content: Matchups are the key to lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable at QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league﻿
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits and more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: 11 freshmen with the most impact -- including three from Stanford
content: Why Jazzy Davidson could make the biggest impact -- and all three Stanford recruits make these preseason rankings.

title: 'Beyond repair': Napheesa Collier, Cathy Engelbert and a WNBA teetering on the brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vini Jr. out, Haaland in at Real Madrid?
content: Real Madrid are ready to replace Vinícius Júnior with Manchester City striker Erling Haaland. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: MotoGP in pictures: Two-wheeled F1 is intoxicatingly raw, full of skill, sacrifice and scars
content: MotoGP, the two-wheeled equivalent of F1, opened its doors to ESPN cameras, revealing a sport that blends exceptional talent with astonishing bravery.

title: Andhra Pradesh government ready to resolve teachers’ issues, says  Lokesh
content: Teachers thank the HRD Minister for smooth inter-district transfers and long-awaited promotions; he urges them to focus on students’ performance

title: Neriamangalam-Valara stretch is on revenue land, says govt. affidavit
content: The Kerala High Court had earlier restricted widening works on the stretch following the govt.’s previous affidavit, stating that the road was on reserve forest land

title: W.B. Governor meets President says law and order in the State is being strangulated
content: Speaking to media persons in Delhi, Dr. Bose evaded questions on the imposition of President Rule under Article 356 in West Bengal. However, the Governor added the Constitution of India has enough provisions to deal with the situation

title: Ecuador President unharmed in attack on motorcade
content: President Daniel Noboa was inaugurating a water treatment plant in central Ecuador when his motorcade was set on by a large group protesting against rising fuel prices

title: APHERMC fines Mohan Babu University ₹15 Lakh, recommends withdrawal of recognition
content: University told to refund ₹26.17 crore collected from students between 2022-23 to September 30, 2024 within 15 days; Pro-Chancellor Vishnu Manchu calls findings by Commission panel mere recommendations

title: “Shiv Sena (UBT) protests against Mahayuti govt aid package for farmers, calls it “misleading”
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) allies Congress and NCP (SP) also called the relief package “hollow” and asked for something “substantial”

title: Fire breaks out at playschool building near Katpadi
content: Police said that a playschool is run on the ground floor of the building, whereas a real estate office is located on the first floor.

title: Work to convert overhead power lines into underground cables around temple nears completion
content: Officials of Tangedco, which executes the work, say that it has been a traditional practice to enforce regular power cuts to houses on key stretches around the temple during festival season to prevent any untoward incidents like electrocution of pilgrims during their visit to the temple.

title: Brief spell of heavy rain throws life out of gear in Vijayawada
content: City receives around 40 mm rain in the evening; commuters, including students, have tough time getting rides

title: Ayodhya represents India’s cultural soul, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Union Finance Minister and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath unveil statues of South Indian music saints

title: Multiple FIRs registered in Punjab on objectionable social media content targeting CJI
content: Social media content relating to attacks on a Constitutional authority, caste-based vilification and incitement, and unjustly exploiting caste and communal sentiments were flagged

title: Two soldiers go missing in Chenab Valley snowstorm during anti-terror operation
content: The operation to trace the missing soldiers is underway on both flanks of the mountains, from the Kishtwar side in the Jammu division and the Kokernag side in the Kashmir division, officials said

title: Odisha to restore Rabindranath Tagore’s residence in Puri
content: The seaside home narrowly escaped demolition by the Puri Municipality after a campaign to preserve it; the property will now be converted into a museum

title: ECI to facilitate elderly, PwD, and service voters to vote using postal ballot in Bihar Assembly polls
content: The electors on essential services on the date of poll can apply for the postal ballot facility through the designated nodal officer of their respective department

title: Amid seat-sharing talks with RJD, Congress clears 25 candidates for Bihar Assembly poll
content: The cleared candidates are for seats in traditional Congress strongholds and will be announced after consultation with alliance partners, say party’s Bihar leaders; insist there is no fight for seats within alliance

title: British Airways to launch third daily London-Delhi flight in 2026, boosting U.K.-India trade amid PM Starmer’s visit
content: IndiGo to enhance connectivity to Manchester with flights from New Delhi from November 15 in addition to thrice weekly flights from Mumbai

title: Draft labour policy proposes to integrate all social security schemes
content: Aims to create universal and portable social security accounts for all workers by 2030; seeks to raise women’s participation in the labour force to 35% by 2030, single-window digital compliance for MSMEs

title: ED cracks down on fake summons scam with new QR code verification system
content: Multiple instances have come to the notice of the ED wherein certain ‘unscrupulous’ persons have sent summonses to individuals with the motive of cheating or extortion

title: JMM leaders meet Tejashwi demanding seven seats; RJD offers two
content: According to JMM sources, the party wants to contest in Chakai, Banka, Katoria, Tarapur, Purnea, Manihari, and Dhamdhaha Assembly seats

title: IAF set to receive first Tejas Mk1A as fighter jet shortage persists
content: HAL’s contract to deliver 83 Tejas Mk1A aircraft has faced delays primarily due to slow engine deliveries

title: Congress, BJP protests demanding Vasavan and Prasanth’s resignation over Sabarimala temple gold-plating roil Kerala
content: Congress’ disruption of the Assembly over  Sabarimala temple gold-plating row spilt onto the street at Mavelikara in Alappuzha and Kannur. BJP workers take out march to Chief Minister’s official residence aeeking CBI enquiry

title: WHO seeks clarification from India if cough syrup linked to child deaths here have been exported
content: Official says that the need for global medical product alert will be investigated only after receiving a response from Indian health authorities

title: India to promote solar pumps scheme in Africa, island nations
content: The International Solar Alliance platform will be used to showcase both the PM-KUSUM and the PM Surya Ghar, Minister for Renewable Energy Pralhad Joshi said

title: Address problems of SC community in Bihar manifesto, confederation tells parties
content: Scheduled Caste community in Bihar continue to be marginalised despite forming nearly one-fifth of the State’s population, says report

title: IISc, IIT-M join forces with GBA for World Bank-funded water security and resilience project
content: A GBA source involved in the project says the civic authority aims not only to mitigate flooding caused by poor stormwater drain infrastructure but also to improve overall water security in the city

title: Jitan Ram Manjhi, Chirag Paswan post cryptic messages on social media, signal unease in NDA seat-sharing talks
content: Leaders invoke poetry and legacy to press the BJP for a “respectable” share of seats in the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections

title: Congress alleges scam in Manipur’s Jal Jeevan Mission, seeks court-monitored probe
content: Calling the episode “a systemic case of data manipulation and fund misappropriation,” party MP Angomcha Bimol Akoijam says the alleged scam occurred at a time when Manipur is already reeling under violence and instability

title: Contract workers at Ambedkar Smriti Vanam demand pay, pending for nine months
content: They blame the contractor and authorities for neglect and vow to continue their demonstration until the government intervenes

title: Job-seekers take to the streets urging State govt. to fill vacancies
content: They say 2.86 lakh posts have fallen vacant in various departments and these are distinct from those pending recruitment in public sector undertakings

title: Tamil Nadu government forms committee to address issues related to blocking/unblocking registration of ryotwari land
content: The Registration Department cannot unilaterally block registration of land without specific instructions, according to a government order

title: Jagan’s sympathies towards government employees are politically motivated, says TDP leader
content: The YSRCP government had reduced the PRC fitment to below IR, diverted the employees’ PF money, and posted teachers at liquor shops, alleges Vijay Kumar

title: Operation Chakra-V: CBI conducts searches across six States in ‘digital arrest’ case
content: The searches were part of the investigation into complaints of ‘digital arrest’ fraud received from nine victims

title: Metro work: ORR service road in Bengaluru’s HSR Layout to remain closed for 45 days
content: The advisory states that the closure is required to facilitate ongoing works by the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd. (BMRCL)

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu reviews preparations for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Andhra Pradesh on October 16
content: The Prime Minister is scheduled to visit the Srisailam temple, and later address a public meeting on GST reforms

title: "Attackers Said They Were Didi's Men": BJP MP On Assault By Mob In Bengal
content: Khagen Murmu, the BJP MP attacked allegedly by Trinamool Congress goons, has vehemently refuted Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's assertion that the locals at the flood-hit Jalpaiguri area where he had gone two days ago to distribute aid, had attacked

title: Zubeen Garg's Cop Cousin Suspended After Arrest In Death Probe
content: Zubeen Garg's cousin and Assam Police DSP Sandipan Garg, arrested on Wednesday in connection with the singer's death in Singapore, has been suspended with immediate effect, an official order said.

title: 'Jhund' Actor Stabbed, Tied With Wire, Left To Die By Friend In Nagpur
content: An actor who played a small but impactful role in the Amitabh Bachchan starrer 'Jhund' was stabbed, hit with a stone, tied with a wire, and left to die by a friend in Nagpur on Wednesday.

title: Man Gets 20 Years Of Rigorous Imprisonment For Raping Minor In Ghaziabad
content: A special court here on Wednesday convicted a man from Muradnagar to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for the rape of a minor girl.

title: Man Kills Wife, Hides Body Under Bed, Flees; Family Claims Dowry Harassment
content: Four months into their marriage, a man in Karnataka's Belagavi allegedly killed his wife, hid her body under the bed in their home and ran away.

title: Scooter Explosion Injures 6 In Kanpur, Probe Underway
content: Six people, including a woman, were injured Wednesday when a blast went off in a busy market in Uttar Pradesh's Karnpur, the police said.

title: Drug Regulator Admits Manufacturing Lapses Amid Outrage Over Cough Syrup Deaths
content: India's top drug regulator has acknowledged serious lapses in pharmaceutical manufacturing practices, amid growing outrage over child deaths allegedly linked to contaminated cough syrups.

title: Delhi Woman Attacks Sleeping Husband With Boiling Oil, Chilli Powder: Cops
content: As Dinesh lay asleep in his Madangir house, his wife poured boiling oil and red chilli powder on him, sending him into screams that rent the dead calm of the night.

title: 19 US Lawmakers Urge Trump To "Reset And Repair" Ties With India
content: 19 US Lawmakers on Wednesday wrote a letter to President Donald Trump urging him to "reset and repair" India-US "critical partnership."

title: Commuter's 'Protruding' Backpack Behind Thane Train Accident That Killed 5
content: A probe by the Central Railway has concluded that a commuter's "protruding" backpack led to the fall of eight travellers from two trains in Thane district in June, of whom five lost their lives.

title: Explained: A To Z Of Delhi's 'Green' Crackers Debate
content: As Diwali approaches, Delhi is again at the centre of a legal debate over firecrackers. Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta will request the Supreme Court to allow the use of certified green firecrackers.

title: 2 Arrested Over Attack On BJP Lawmakers In Flood-Hit North Bengal: Cops
content: Two persons were arrested on Wednesday in connection with the attack on BJP lawmakers Khagen Murmu and Sankar Ghosh in the flood-hit northern West Bengal, police said.

title: 'India United Only Under Aurangzeb': Pak's Khawaja Asif's Provocative Remark
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made yet another baseless claim, saying India was "never truly united" except under the rule of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb -- a statement that easily crumbles under the weight of basic historical facts.

title: Exclusive: How Madhya Pradesh's Drug System Failed To Stop A 'Killer' Syrup
content: In Madhya Pradesh, 20 children are dead and seven more are battling for life after consuming a toxic cough syrup that should never have reached them.

title: Maharshi Valmiki Wrote Ramayana To End World's Sorrow: Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has stated that Maharshi Valmiki wrote the Ramayana to alleviate the sorrow in the world, emphasising that Indians should carry forward this culture and tradition as a responsibility towards humanity.

title: PM Uses P Chidambaram's Remarks As Ammo, Attacks Congress On 26/11 Response
content: Training his guns on the Congress, using former Union minister P Chidambaram's remarks as ammunition, PM Narendra Modi has said the opposition party had succumbed to international pressure in deciding not take military against Pakistan.

title: Assam's Tea Garden Workers March To Demand Scheduled Tribes Status
content: Thousands of people from the tea garden community hit the streets of eastern Assam's Tinsukia district today, demanding Scheduled Tribe status. The demand has been a long-standing one.

title: Amid Ceasefire Talks, A Look At Prominent Palestinians In Israeli Jails
content: Israel hopes the ceasefire talks will lead to the release or recovery of the bodies of the remaining 48 hostages seized during the October 7, 2023 attacks, 20 of whom are believed to be alive.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport A Symbol Of Bharat's Aspirations: Gautam Adani
content: Gautam Adani highlighted the completion of the Navi Mumbai airport, which was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, as a major achievement in India's economic development and "a symbol of Bharat's aspirations".

title: Opinion: Analysis - Bihar 2025: The Poll That Could Turn On 6,300 Votes
content: The latest Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of Bihar's electoral roll has concluded with a significant reduction of 51 lakh voters, amounting to a 6% drop from the rolls as of May 2025.

title: New proxy war? Pak's ISI forges LeT-ISKP alliance; what it means for India's security
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba and ISKP have reportedly formed a covert alliance in Balochistan. This partnership is allegedly engineered and funded by Pakistan's ISI. The groups aim to target Baloch people. There is a possibility of expansion to Jammu and Kashmir. Visual evidence shows commanders training together. This alliance follows India's counterterror actions.

title: 'Reset & repair ties with India': US lawmakers write to Trump over tariffs
content: Twenty-one US lawmakers urged President Trump to reset ties with India, warning his punitive tariffs are harming both nations and pushing New Delhi towards rivals like China and Russia. The letter highlighted the strategic importance of India in the Indo-Pacific and the economic damage caused by the tariffs to American consumers and businesses.

title: Bihar polls: Smaller NDA allies flex muscle; will BJP, JD(U) fight on fewer seats?
content: Bihar's ruling NDA faces seat-sharing hurdles as smaller allies, including LJP (RV) and HAM, escalate their demands. The BJP and JD(U) are reportedly set to contest fewer seats than in 2020 to accommodate these requests. The alliance is working towards finalizing strategies and candidates ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Who is Jonathan Rinderknecht? Former Uber driver arrested for Palisades fire
content: A former Uber driver, Jonathan Rinderknecht, has been arrested in Florida and charged with maliciously starting the deadly Pacific Palisades fire. The blaze, which claimed 12 lives and caused extensive destruction, began shortly after midnight on New Year's Day. Investigators allege Rinderknecht was at the scene before the fire erupted.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos: I always advise to young people - 'Go work at ...'
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos advises young aspiring entrepreneurs to gain foundational experience by working at McDonald's. He emphasizes that such roles teach crucial skills like responsibility, discipline, and customer interaction, which are vital for long-term success and often overlooked by Gen Z in their pursuit of rapid startup growth.

title: Controversy! Indian water polo team face scrutiny; here's why
content: India's men's water polo team sparked controversy at the Asian Aquatics Championships by displaying the national flag on their swimming trunks, violating the Flag Code of India. Officials have sought a report, and the Swimming Federation of India has assured the flag will be moved to skull caps in future matches.

title: 'Like a slum': UK MP's 'racist' remarks sparks outcry; defends comments
content: Tory MP Robert Jenrick has sparked outrage with comments describing Birmingham's Handsworth as a "slum" and "one of the worst integrated places" he'd visited, claiming he saw "no other white face." Jenrick defended his remarks, stating some areas are "largely segregated" and this should be discussed openly. Locals have strongly refuted his characterization of the diverse neighborhood.

title: 'Key growth engine': IMF hails India's economy; what's impact of Trump tariffs?
content: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva hailed India as a “key growth engine” of the global economy. She also said that the global economy is faring better than feared, but warned resilience may not last amid Trump-era tariffs, rising debt, and global uncertainty. Despite US-imposed tariffs, India recorded 7.8% GDP growth in Q1 FY 2025–26, driven by consumption and investment.

title: Tech regulation: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to Google, Apple; ‘Follow Indian law’
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu outlined his company's three-tiered approach to user privacy on X. He detailed protections for "secret lover" data, a pledge against using customer data for advertising, and the limits of corporate responsibility in "secret rebel" cases, emphasizing adherence to national laws.

title: Women's WC: AUS humiliate PAK; Mooney's century help Aussies top standings
content: Beth Mooney's spectacular 109, aided by Alana King's 51, rescued Australia from 76/7 to 221/9 against Pakistan.  The bowlers then delivered a dominant performance, with Kim Garth taking three wickets, to bowl out Pakistan for 114, securing a commanding 107-run victory. This win keeps Australia unbeaten, while Pakistan faced a third consecutive loss.

title: Soybeans are new rare earths: Xi hits Trump where it hurts - US heartland
content: China's abrupt halt to US soybean purchases, a critical export, has sent prices plummeting and farmers into panic. This strategic move, mirroring past rare earth tactics, aims to pressure President Trump ahead of the APEC summit. Farmers face a double blow of rising costs and a vanishing market, with potential for significant economic fallout in rural America.

title: Kanpur scooter blast: 8 injured in explosion at market; probe underway
content: A powerful explosion rocked Kanpur's Meston Road marketplace on Wednesday evening. Eight people were injured, with two in critical condition. The blast occurred outside a plastic shop, damaging parked scooters and nearby structures. Investigations are underway to determine the cause, with possibilities including illegal firecrackers or a battery. Authorities are reviewing CCTV footage and questioning shopkeepers.

title: ‘3 prizes in 2 years’: CEO Pichai celebrates Googlers winning Nobel Prize; says ‘Feeling lucky’
content: Google's Sundar Pichai celebrated Michel Devoret, John Martinis, and John Clarke's 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics. This marks Google's fifth Nobel laureate in two years, with Devoret leading hardware at Quantum AI and Martinis a former hardware team leader. Their foundational 1980s quantum mechanics research is credited with enabling future error-corrected quantum computers.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Rohit doesn’t deserve this’ - Ex-cricketer urges him to retire with dignity
content: Former India cricketer Manoj Tiwary urged Rohit Sharma to retire from international cricket, citing the recent ODI captaincy change to Shubman Gill as humiliating. Tiwary believes Rohit should step down with dignity before being pushed out, despite his impressive ODI record and captaincy achievements.

title: CJI Gavai attack: FIRs filed over casteist remarks online in Punjab
content: Following an advocate's shoe-hurling attempt at the Chief Justice of India, Punjab Police have registered multiple FIRs against over 100 social media handles. These accounts are accused of posting objectionable content, including casteist remarks and incitement, aimed at disturbing peace and eroding respect for judicial institutions. Investigations are underway.

title: Bradford Freeman net worth: How rich is the man behind Stanford’s $50m donation?
content: Stanford football received a historic $50 million donation from alumnus Bradford M. Freeman, the largest individual gift not tied to facilities. This transformative contribution will fund five new scholarships and bolster the university's NIL infrastructure. Freeman's generosity aims to usher in a new era of excellence and competitiveness for the Cardinal program.

title: Dwyane Wade mocks father after three failed marriages; Wade Sr fires back in viral video
content: Basketball legend Dwyane Wade shared heartwarming life lessons on love and marriage with his father, Dwyane Wade Sr., on his podcast.  Wade Sr.'s advice, rooted in his own experiences, emphasizes mutual respect and individuality. This wisdom now informs Wade's strong relationship with wife Gabrielle Union, built on trust and support.

title: Offset breaks silence: Rapper admits fault in failed marriage to Cardi B; Social media reacts
content: A viral rumor claimed Offset regretted cheating on Cardi B after her pregnancy with Stefon Diggs. Offset did admit to past infidelity in a recent interview. However, he never linked his regrets to Diggs or Cardi's current pregnancy. Fans appear to have combined Offset's old confessions with Cardi's new relationship. This has created a false narrative online.

title: Happy Karwa Chauth 2025: Top 50 wishes, quotes and WhatsApp statuses to share
content: Karwa Chauth, a Hindu festival, celebrates love, devotion, and marital happiness with married women observing a fast from sunrise to moonrise for their husbands' well-being. The day involves customary ceremonies and fosters solidarity, family spirit, and cultural traditions, highlighting the power of relationships and loyalty.

title: 'If you shout ...': Wife pours boiling oil on husband, throws chili powder on burns
content: A woman in South Delhi allegedly poured boiling oil on her sleeping husband, with their eight-year-old daughter reportedly present. The victim sustained "dangerous" burns and was warned by his wife not to shout. Neighbours intervened and rushed him to the hospital. The woman has been booked under relevant sections of the BNS, but no arrests have been made.

title: No roadmap! Ashwin on Virat, Rohit treatment - 'They deserve better'
content: Former spinner R. Ashwin urges Indian cricket management to improve how senior players like Kohli and Rohit are handled. He stresses the importance of transparent communication and knowledge transfer, not just about batting, but also about managing pressure and injuries. Ashwin believes a clear roadmap is crucial for a smooth transition, preventing speculation and leaving players in a vulnerable position.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Drug regulator issues alert; urges testing compliance
content: Following child deaths linked to cough syrups, India's drug regulator has issued an urgent alert to states. Manufacturers are now mandated to rigorously test all raw materials and finished products, ensuring compliance with drug-testing rules. The directive emphasizes robust vendor qualification and sourcing from approved suppliers to prevent future health risks to children.

title: 'Don't trust him': Mamata warns PM Modi; likens Shah to Mir Zafar
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused Union Home Minister Amit Shah of acting like a "Prime Minister" and cautioned PM Modi. She criticized the central government's flood relief efforts and alleged a lack of support. Banerjee also highlighted ongoing relief and rehabilitation work in flood-affected North Bengal, promising further oversight.

title: Sanju trolled! Rohit Sharma mimics Asia Cup winner, Iyer laughs - watch
content: Rohit Sharma's humorous side shone at a recent award night, where he playfully mimicked Sanju Samson's walk, delighting fans. Despite stepping down as ODI captain, his infectious energy and leadership presence remain a significant asset for the Indian team as they prepare for the upcoming series against Australia that will commence on October 19.

title: 'India wanted PoK back': Tejashwi says PM Modi yielded to Trump
content: Tejashwi Yadav criticized PM Modi for agreeing to a ceasefire with Pakistan after a single tweet from US President Trump, shattering hopes of reclaiming PoK. This follows PM Modi's demand for Congress to clarify who prevented military retaliation after the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, a decision influenced by international pressure, including from the US.

title: Top 5 richest footballers in the world: Faiq Bolkiah, Ronaldo, Messi, and more
content: Football's wealthiest stars are revealed, with a surprising name topping the list. While Cristiano Ronaldo recently joined the billionaire club, he's not the richest. Discover the Brunei royal who commands a staggering fortune, alongside other football titans like Messi and Beckham, and their impressive net worths.

title: 'Glimpse of Viksit Bharat': PM hails Navi Mumbai airport; how it will help farmers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Navi Mumbai International Airport on Wednesday. Built by the Adani Group under a Public Private Partnership, this massive greenfield project, costing Rs 19,650 crore for its first phase, will ease congestion at Mumbai's existing airport.

title: ‘Not an insult’: Nakamura defends king toss at Gukesh; calls it pure entertainment
content: Hikaru Nakamura defended tossing D Gukesh's king into the crowd at an exhibition event, stating it was part of the organizers' entertainment format. He clarified it was not an insult, emphasizing the difference between a serious tournament and a purely entertainment-focused match. Nakamura also playfully suggested Gukesh could dance on the chessboard if he wins the reverse match in India.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says no degree needed for six-figure jobs
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says skilled trades like electricians, plumbers, and carpenters can earn six-figure salaries without college degrees, driven by the rapid growth of data centers. As AI infrastructure expands, demand for hands-on expertise is soaring, offering lucrative, stable careers. Huang urges young professionals to value practical, science-based skills over traditional academic routes.

title: Tata discord: Shah, FM’s firm msg - ‘do what it takes’ to restore stability
content: Amit Shah and Nirmala Sitharaman met with Tata group executives to urge stability within Tata Trusts and prevent internal conflicts from impacting Tata Sons. The ministers reportedly expressed serious concerns about the ongoing discord and supported stringent measures against trustees deemed responsible for creating disruptions.

title: Asia Cup trophy drama | Sanju breaks silence: 'We don't have anything'
content: India's Asia Cup victory was marred by a bizarre trophy controversy after the ACC chief left the stadium with the silverware. Despite the confusion, wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson revealed the team celebrated with an "imaginary trophy," maintaining a positive dressing room environment. The incident has led to an administrative standoff, with the trophy still missing.

title: Chemistry Nobel explained: How winners created materials to save planet
content: So, say hello to the men who turned chemistry from Breaking Bad into Breaking Good. This year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry is actually pretty easy to get — and no, it doesn’t involve blue crystals or an RV in the desert. The 2025 Nobel went to Richard Robson, Susumu Kitagawa, and Omar Yaghi for inventing something called metal–organic frameworks, or MOFs. If that sounds like chemistry jargon designed to make you feel stupid, relax. MOFs are basically sponges made of metal and carbon, but on a molecular level — invisible, perfect, and outrageously clever.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Furore over doctor's arrest; FAIMA writes to Centre
content: Medical associations are demanding the immediate release of a doctor arrested in connection with child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrup. They urge a thorough investigation to ensure justice for victims and protect medical professionals from wrongful blame. The group also proposed measures to the health ministry to prevent future incidents, including central oversight and nationwide drug testing.

title: Dementia starts in your legs, top neurosurgeon warns
content: A leading neurosurgeon reveals a surprising link between leg strength and dementia prevention.  Weak leg muscles can accelerate cognitive decline, as active muscles release chemicals vital for brain health.  Maintaining strong legs through walking and strength training is crucial for protecting memory and preventing falls, offering a powerful strategy to safeguard your brain's well-being.

title: PM launches Mumbai Metro Aqua Line-3: Check stations, route, timings & travel time
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the final phase of Mumbai Metro Aqua Line-3 on October 9, 2025. This Rs 12,000 crore phase connects business hubs, entertainment zones, and the airport, integrating with existing transport networks. The entire 33.5 km underground line will serve 13 lakh passengers daily.

title: Israel intercepts another Gaza aid flotilla: Soldier tries to destroy camera - watch
content: Israel intercepted a nine-boat aid flotilla carrying food and medical supplies, two days after deporting 171 activists. Troops boarded the vessels 120 nautical miles off Gaza's coast, with activists reporting an Israeli helicopter overhead. Israel stated the 145 activists were in good health and would be deported, calling the attempt to breach the blockade futile.

title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry: Trio win top honours for 'creating new rules'
content: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry honours Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi. They developed metal-organic frameworks, a new molecular architecture. These porous materials offer custom-made solutions for energy, storage, and catalysis. This breakthrough revolutionises material design with vast potential for new functions.

title: Auston Matthews’ comment on Connor McDavid’s contract angers Maple Leafs fans
content: Toronto Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews faced fan backlash after a comment about Connor McDavid's contract was misinterpreted. While intended as praise for McDavid's winning focus, critics accused Matthews of lacking the same drive. Fans, frustrated by playoff exits, questioned his priorities, especially given his lucrative deal, highlighting dwindling patience until a Stanley Cup is delivered.

title: Bihar polls: CM face confusion in MGB, seat chaos in NDA - decoding political drama
content: Bihar's upcoming assembly elections are marked by poetic negotiations and power plays within alliances. Jitan Ram Manjhi invokes poetry for fair seat-sharing in NDA, while Left allies in Mahagathbandhan reject 'insulting' proposals. The absence of a clear chief ministerial face and leadership confusion are key issues.

title: Bihar polls: Manjhi takes poetic dig at BJP; seat-sharing talks begin
content: Bihar's political landscape is heating up with seat-sharing talks and upcoming elections. Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi's cryptic post hints at dissatisfaction with NDA negotiations, while Tejashwi Yadav expresses confidence in the opposition's push for change.  With JD(U) and BJP leading, smaller parties and new fronts are maneuvering for influence.

title: Warriors vs Trail Blazers Preseason: Schedule, where to watch, injury update
content: The Portland Trail Blazers are set to face the Golden State Warriors in their first 2025-26 NBA preseason game. The Warriors, having already defeated the Lakers, aim to continue their preseason success. However, both teams are dealing with significant player absences, including Stephen Curry's brother Seth Curry for the Warriors and Damian Lillard for the Blazers.

title: The 2000 Sooners and 19 other unlikely champions
content: the Longhorns are two possessions away from being undefeated and harps on limiting their balanced attack of arch Manning and Quintrevion Wisner . the Sooners had gone just 44-45-3 over the previous eight seasons, handcuffed first by NCAA sanctions and then by two poor head coaching hires . but second-year head coach Bob Stoops led them to a decent 7-5 campaign in 1999, and with quarterback Josh Heupel slinging the ball around more than 35 times

title: Leicester's 2015-16 Premier League champions: Where are they now?
content: the odds are stacked against any club hoping to repeat Leicester City's unlikely premier league title win . a decade ago, the Foxes were about to become the most improbable title winners of all time . from stars Jamie Vardy and Riyad Mahrez to role players such as Shinji Okazaki and Jeffrey Schlupp, each of that team's key contributors is today .
